jobs.title: Business Analysis & Quality Assurance Manager
jobs.description:
Adecco is currently seeking an experienced Business Analysis & Quality Assurance Manager to join our client's team in Toronto, ON. This is a full-time position with a large reputable company in the automotive finance industry.

If you are seeking a long-term career opportunity in a challenging and dynamic environment, and you possess the skills and leadership qualities mentioned above, we strongly encourage you to submit your application. This role offers a competitive salary, outstanding benefits, and the chance to play a substantial role in the automotive sales and marketing field.

Location: Toronto, ON. Hybrid work model

Duties and Responsibilities
• Manage business analysts, distribute project/guide and communicate BA’s work.
• Participates in projects, leads and documents requirements following agile and classic project methodologies.
• Acts as technical point of contact to business users with respect to system functions and features. Provides guidance regarding system... capabilities and configuration. Liaises with vendors to address system defects and requested system enhancements.
• Leads and reviews the QA testing efforts of new solutions by coordinating with development to ensure test plans and test cases reflect business requirements. Acts as point of contact for business users during user acceptance testing.
• Supports production inquiries and assist with troubleshooting system issues.
• Support UAT activities and manage defects reported during UAT.
• All other duties as assigned.

Requirements
• 7+ years related experience in business systems
• 3+ years of experience working within IT development project teams
• Knowledge of consumer finance business processes such as credit adjudication, funding, servicing, or collections (required)
• Understanding of basic financial principles and accounting for consumer finance contracts (required)
• Skilled at eliciting, analyzing, documenting and communicating functional and non-functional requirements for business systems.
• Full understanding of system development life cycle and agile methodology.
• Excellent understanding of QA methodology.
• Strong communication skills, especially the ability to explain system and technical topics to others who may have minimal technical knowledge.
• Demonstrated skills with all MS Office, Visio, data analysis tools, UML, SQL, relational databases.
• Able to quickly grasp and understand business processes and identify process improvements.
• Strong research, analytical, organization and time/project management skills.
• Detail oriented – maintain high levels of quality and productivity

To indicate your interest in this position, please apply online. A recruiter from Adecco will reach out to you shortly.

Description:

We are looking for an experience Business Analyst who can join a team focusing on end-user research and identifying user requirements and recommendations. Looking for someone who can help bridge the gap between IT and business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements, and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders.

• Work in partnership with clients, advising them on information technology in order to meet their business objectives or overcome problems, work to improve structure and efficiency of an organization’s I&IT systems.

jobs.description:
Job Description

This is a hybrid role with a mix of remote and in-office working

Current work authorization for Canada is required for all openings.

Who We Are

At Fidelity, we’ve been helping Canadian investors build better financial futures for over 35 years. We offer individuals and institutions a range of trusted investment portfolios and services - and we’re constantly seeking to find new and better ways to help our clients. As a privately owned company, we boldly embrace innovation in all areas as we continue to grow our business into the future.

Working with us means you’ll be part of a diverse and dedicated group of people who make a real difference for our clients and communities every day. You’ll have a wide range of opportunities to grow and develop your career in an inclusive environment where you’ll feel valued and supported to be your best - both personally and professionally.

Fidelity Clearing Canada (FCC) is the leading independent clearing broker and custodian in... the Canadian market. We provide trade execution, clearing, custody and back-office support services to Canadian-based brokerage firms and the Canadian brokerage arms of U.S.-based firms.

For more information about Fidelity Clearing Canada, please visit https//clearing.fidelity.ca/

How You’ll Make An Impact

Position Overview

As the VP, Development and Business Analysis FCC, you will be a member of the FCC Technology Senior Leadership Team reporting to the FCC Chief Technology Officer with overall responsibility for development, business analysis and testing in support of Fidelity Clearing Canada. The role contributes to establishing the strategic direction of systems supporting Fidelity Clearing Canada with responsibilities for driving innovation and providing direction and oversight to a team of Directors, seasoned developers, and analysts, including quality assurance. You provide leadership/guidance to the business and technology areas while providing leadership and support for new and existing applications. Additionally, you will collaborate with senior partners within FIC, Fidelity Canada, and FIL to leverage solutions and adopt emerging corporate standards and technologies

Key Accountabilities / Responsibilities

Project Delivery
• Acts as the technology owner for major/critical/strategic projects.
• Takes full responsibility for the development and implementation success of FCC’s critical projects by working in close relationships with the Project Manager, the business, and external partners to control the results.
• Provide extremely close follow-up on project advancement, excellent communication with all parties and ensure support of new products and services is seamlessly transitioned to the appropriate support team.
• Participate on steering committees for projects and takes accountability for the budget and delivery schedule of projects delivered by the team

Relationship Management
• Engage and build relationships with senior business leaders, external partners, and with other Fidelity companies to reach a common goal for standards, processes, expertise, development, and project delivery

Support Services
• Ensure that FCC’s business units have systems and processes that are reliable and robust for all aspects that relate to application architecture, development, and support.
• Ensure FCC’s applications are in line with client and customer expectations, working to incorporate feedback to keep improving client experience

Business planning
• Establish, manage, and control budget, yearly objectives, and long-term planning for the business analysis and development groups.
• Be an active participant in annual business planning cycle bringing forward relevant input for consideration as it pertains to your teams and responsible applications to the business planning cycle.

Leadership
• Foster an environment that seeks to identify and develop high potential individuals and successors.
• Develop and motivate senior staff through individual development programs and effective training programs, by example and leadership
• Create a culture of innovation and forward thinking within the team
• Provide leadership that helps improve level of efficiency, effectiveness, professionalism, and employee engagement
• Set challenging goals and work standards
• Effectively communicate goals and priorities through regular feedback

Innovation
• Continually find new and innovative ways to use technology to drive better client experiences, sales, workflow and automation enhancements, business process improvements, and/or IT cost efficiencies, to instill this in the team and effectively communicate within FCC

Experience

What We Are Looking For
• 7+ years of experience in senior level management positions overseeing complex information technology service units for major organizations
• 7+ years of experience within the financial services industry
• Experience in the administration of management information systems and enterprise technologies
• Experience with Broadridge Dataphile
• Experience with Retail Wealth Management in Canada

Education
• University degree in a relevant field or equivalent work experience

The Expertise You Bring
• Demonstrate ability in business technology planning, including collaborative decision-making processes.
• Demonstrate commitment to continuous improvement and adoption of best practices
• Ability to work collaboratively with business, industry, and partner/parent organizations
• Ability to create and manage an integrated development life cycle; ability to integrate technology innovations into ongoing practices
• Strong written, verbal, and listening skills to enable the formation and communication of information technology vision and implementation.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, including demonstrated skills in business analysis and design.
• Thorough knowledge of hardware, software, and current and emerging information and technology services
• Knowledge and experience the financial services industry
• Demonstrated change management and delivery capabilities at an enterprise level.
• Strong negotiation and partner management skills.
• Ability to work collaboratively with business, industry, and partner/parent organizations
• Ability to understand and communicate the broader picture to all stakeholders and to demonstrate an understanding of stakeholder interests (both business and technical)
• Knowledge of systems development methodologies, standards, tools, and techniques
• Proven experience working in a complex environment where relationship building is critical, yet at the same time being entrepreneurial and fast paced
• Technical expertise across various domains
• Ability to think strategically about market opportunities and innovation.
• Excellent communication, leadership, facilitation, negotiation, influence, and customer relationship management skills

Some of the ways we’ll help you feel valued and supported as part of our team
• Flexible working arrangements - 100% remote, hybrid, and in office options
• Competitive total compensation, including company contributions to your group RRSP without a matching requirement from you
• Comprehensive health benefits that start on your first day, with 100% employer-paid premiums, that include up to $5000 annually for mental health services and therapy
• Parental leave top-up to 100% of your salary for a period of 25 weeks

• Diversity and inclusion programs, including an active network of Employee Resource Groups
• Extensive professional development opportunities, including access to over 11,000 training and development courses, tuition reimbursement, and monetary rewards for completing a required designation

jobs.title: Business Analyst
jobs.description:
We are looking for an IT Business Analyst to join its highly skilled team in Toronto to help our clients succeed and contribute to the company's success.

Position Summary:

The Client Engagement team is responsible for driving successful end-to-end delivery of a foreign exchange and payment platform to meet our client’s business requirements within constraints of timescale, cost & quality, as well as working with cross-functional teams (developers, infrastructure engineers, product specialists, sales directors, traders).

As an IT Business Analyst, your responsibilities will include the following:
• Delivery
• Lead the end-to-end implementation of software integration projects for clients, ensuring successful delivery within specified timelines and quality standards.
• Establish project plans for major project upgrades and communicate with clients regarding project-related activities, serving as the primary point of contact for project updates and addressing any concerns or... questions.
• Organize and conduct workshops (detailed requirement gathering) with clients to demonstrate the platform, sharing knowledge on our FX market/trading solution.
• Carrying out demonstrations and training sessions for clients and assisting with functional, product, and technical support.
• Collaboration, conflict management, and negotiating with client, R&D, and Operations teams on testing, project planning, and delivery, requirement analysis,
• Take ownership of SIT, UAT, and production deployments, including configuration, environment setup, maintaining configuration inventory, and preparing comprehensive guides for clients.
• Perform platform configuration to the needs of the client and satisfy contractual requirements.
• Troubleshoot issues - investigating client setup, platform setup, integration-related issues, and other issues as required.
• Consultation - Business and System Analysis
• Engage in discussions with the client’s business team to understand and analyze the client's unique business cases and value propositions.
• Serve as the primary contact for new integration items and lead discussions with banks and third-party systems, ensuring effective communication and collaboration. This entails understanding and analyzing the client's integration and orchestration requirements and explaining our platform's capabilities.
• Sharing knowledge on our FX market/trading solution acquired through experience and exposure in the company
• Clarify independently or with the product and R&D team to write up comprehensive business requirements for client sign-off and development team.
• Team, Management, and Product Support
• Act as a mentor and guide for new team members and collaborate with experienced team members, assisting them in acquiring a solid understanding of the product, implementation processes, and FX knowledge.
• Support the quality assurance, support, and operations teams, addressing their inquiries, providing technical assistance, and sharing expertise as needed.
• Continuous Process Improvements - Contribute to the improvement and optimization of internal processes, methodologies, and documentation.

Position Requirements:
• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Engineering.
• Minimum three years of experience in an IT Business Analyst role related to foreign currency payments, foreign exchange trading, counterparty onboarding, client risk management concepts, user management, forex pricing, system integration, and requirements gathering & documentation.
• Practical knowledge of SQL, XML, integration workflow best practices, Postman and Linux commands to investigate and check logs.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills in English.
• Strong stakeholder management (clients and internal stakeholders).
• Hands-on software project management experience and ability to prepare project plans.
• Quick learner with strong organizational skills and experience in dealing with the pressure of meeting client timelines and demands.
• Type of contract: full-time, permanent role.
• The position is based in Toronto, but some travel may be required from time to time (around 20%)

About smart Trade

smartTrade Technologies is an innovative global software company providing electronic trading and payment solutions with offices in London, Milan, Aix-en-Provence, New York, Singapore, and Tokyo.

Our clients are banks, stock exchanges, brokers, and hedge funds. smartTrade enables the management of financial foreign exchange and payment workflows for the banks and commercial clients of the banks

jobs.title: Sr. Business Analyst - People, Strategy & Analytics
jobs.description:
161 Bay Street (93021), Canada, Toronto,Toronto, Ontario,

Sr. Business Analyst - People, Strategy & Analytics

Our Capital One Team

Yes, we’re a credit card company. But we’re more than that too. We’re driven by what our customers want, and how to make their lives simpler.

We’re always looking for creative ways to offer digital solutions that make sense for our customers. With your help, we’ll build the next generation of banking in Canada based on customer-focused values, compelling products and great engineering.

Working with us

How do we do things at Capital One Canada? We listen — to our people, and to our customers. We change with the times and have adopted a hybrid model (remote and in-office). Associates working in the hybrid model are expected to come into the office 3 days a week across Tuesdays and Thursdays, reserving Mondays and Fridays as company-wide virtual days. As was true before the pandemic, expectations of being in the office will be balanced with personal... life flexibility.

At Capital One we’re committed to diversity, inclusion and belonging. We strive to build a culture where diverse perspectives are valued, innovative ideas are encouraged and inclusive behaviors are embedded in everything we do to positively impact associates. Strive to build a culture where diverse perspectives are valued, innovative ideas are encouraged and to help challenge the status quo and create the best outcomes for everyone.

We’re focused on helping associates live well—physically, financially and emotionally. When you join us, we support you and those who are most important to you, offering full coverage for spouses, domestic partners, and dependents. We’ve designed our benefits program to be flexible, comprehensive and consistent across our organization. From health and fitness center discounts, to training and professional development programs—and much more—you’ll discover that Capital One is committed to helping you live your best life.

Capital One Canada is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment. We consider all qualified applicants and will meet the needs of those requiring reasonable accommodations.

A day in the life of a Sr. Business Analyst - People, Strategy & Analytics

People Strategy & Analytics is an emerging field where Capital One is on the leading front. Our team brings data, analytics, and insights to shape critical talent decisions and strategy at Capital One. We work closely with HR partners and senior executives in shaping talent policy, automating real-time data and improving talent decision-making. The team is comprised of people with diverse skills and backgrounds including: data analysts and engineers, product managers, data scientists, consultants and strategists, business analysts, HR specialists, economists, and Industrial Organizational Psychologists.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will apply your strategic and analytical skills to solve open-ended, complex questions about how we should attract, develop, and retain top talent. You will team up with world-class professionals and senior leadership and work on impactful projects.

Your day-to-day might involve:
• Using data to help executives set ambitious but achievable diversity goals
• Building models to predict attrition, and testing new retention strategies
• Designing new ways to understand and measure associate potential
• Developing analyses and tools to help Capital One source and hire the best talent

You will get to do this in a collaborative environment that promotes continuous learning, rewards innovation, and prioritizes your development.

Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Strategic problem solving: Identify high impact opportunities to transform the associate experience, conduct analysis, and share insights that inform solutions
• Design: Drive and build key programs and analytics solutions for our partners, including measurement strategy, attribution modeling, and automated insights
• Experimentation: Partner with clients in experiment design to better understand key drivers of associate behavior
• Insights & analysis: Analyze the impact of our programs and combine those insights with the latest thinking in organizational science to help our clients make data-driven, informed decisions

Successful team members demonstrate competencies in these areas:
• Purpose: You feel a deep personal connection to improving the associate experience and are motivated by applying advanced analytics in a mission-driven way
• Analytical thinking: A proven track record of decision making and problem solving based on analytics. Conceptual thinking skills must be complemented by a strong quantitative orientation. Identify opportunities for improvement and use data to make strategic and tactical recommendations
• Execution: Develop and test hypotheses, design solutions, assess operational feasibility, support implementation efforts, and develop plans and tools for monitoring outcomes
• Partnership: Collaborate effectively with other team members and clients in HR
• Communication: Strong written and oral communication skills, including visualization skills (i.e., able to “tell the story” and highlight key insights in a clear and concise manner that is easily understood by stakeholders)
• Results focus: Drives for results and achieves important goals applying strong organizational skills and detail orientation, even amidst ambiguity

Basic Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s Degree in any quantitative field (Business, Math, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Science, Engineering)
• At least 1 year of experience in analysis

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s Degree in Business or quantitative field such as Finance, Economics, Physical Sciences, Math, Statistics, Engineering
• 1+ years of experience in Statistical model building
• 1+ years of experience in market research
• 1+ years of experience in SQL querying
• 2+ years of experience in business analysis

Department Overview
Department Overview :

Our vision to be the Better Bank is grounded in our purpose-driven and forward-focused strategy. Amidst a rapidly changing landscape, we know that technology plays a critical role in achieving this vision and delivering on our strategy.

It also signals the need to accelerate investment in emerging capabilities to adapt to the changes happening around us and respond to customer needs more quickly. To accomplish this, we're evolving our Platforms, introducing key enterprise Practices and re-imagining our customer Journeys as part of the Next Evolution of Work (NEW).NEW will empower colleagues to make decisions faster, work more efficiently and quickly identify... and address customer and market trends to deliver innovative solutions at an unprecedented pace.

NEW will enable us to move with purpose towards common goals, simplify how we work and elevate how we deliver customer value. By joining NEW, you'll have the opportunity to be part of a new way of working while making an impact on the future of banking in ways you've never imagined.

Introducing the Data as a Service (DaaS) Platform! This Platform will develop a centralized data strategy and roadmap to enable TD to shift to a data-driven organization and help us extract value from the data we create, collect and consume. The Platform will include applications responsible for the creation and management of data lakes, standards, analytical tools and governance. DaaS will consolidate over ~110assets and ~200applications, aggregate our customer data, and bring together data subject matter experts from Practices, such as Data, Business Analysis, Software Engineering and Quality Engineering.

TD has built an on-premise data lake environment over the last few years as part of its integrated data and analytics strategy. While this strategy has successfully integrated the majority of TD's data assets into an integrated platform and enabled a number of key TD Segment data strategies (e.g. TDI, Personal Banking and Wealth), a number of challenges and opportunities exist towards unlocking full potential of TD's data assets in a timely and cost-effective manner. TD's target state Data and Analytics platform will be built on Azure Cloud to address the on-premise scalability and cost challenges, as well as realizing broader benefit from TD data assets.

Job Details

• Responsible for documentation management for Business Operations and Project artifacts (ie. Operations Manuals, Business Process Documentation, procedural documentation, user guides, FAQs, etc)

• Work closely with control partners (ie. Privacy, Risk, Security, TRMIS) to adhere to internal policies / procedures and applicable regulatory guidelines, contribute to the review of internal processes and activities and assist in identifying potential opportunities to improve operational efficiencies.
• Work and collaborate with Technology partners, business partners, and control partners to define interaction models and RACI
• Identifying business needs and determining solutions to business problems by analyzing options/solutions which may include a technology component, but may also consist of process improvement, organizational change or strategic planning and/or policy development
• Working collaboratively with technology partners, operational areas, vendors, business stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage business requirements
• Assessing, documenting and validating current states processes, understanding the problem statement and business needs to deliver effective solutions that address business problems and align to strategic business goals
• Gather required information and document/map current and future processes(Target Operating Models), provide input and recommendations to support process improvement
• Streamline and standardize procedures representing the process mitigate errors, reduce risk, providing consistency
• Review & evaluates company database(s), Identifies data sources, constructs data decomposition diagrams, provides data flow diagrams and documents the process.
• Supporting project delivery, testing and implementation activities to deliver business benefits and achieve business results/objectives

Company Overview
Our Values
At TD we're guided by our purpose is to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues, and share a set of values that shape our culture and guide our behavior. In exchange for how our colleagues show up to help TD succeed, we are committed to delivering a colleague experience grounded in Impact, Growth and a Culture of Care. No matter where you work across TD, we empower you to make an impact at work and in your community, explore and grow your career and be part of our caring and inclusive culture.

Making Your Well-being a Priority
A caring and supportive culture that promotes colleague well-being is core to who we are. At TD, we focus on total well-being with extensive programs to help colleagues assess, manage, and improve their well-being across four core pillars — physical, financial, social and mental/emotional. In addition, we champion a safe, inclusive and supportive work environment to help colleagues feel a sense of belonging, and supported in their personal and professional growth. Through our focus on total well-being, we know that we can help our colleagues thrive, contribute to our culture of care, and support better business outcomes … because when colleagues feel their best, they're more likely to do their best.

Our Total Rewards package reflects the investment we make in our colleagues to help them, and their families achieve their well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits including medical, dental, vision & mental health coverage, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs.

How We Work
At TD, we believe in-person connections fuel collaboration and collective creativity. Our workplace experience empowers colleagues to do great work side-by-side at TD locations, while offering flexibility to work remotely where it makes sense for the work and team. Our teams work in one of three workplace models: hybrid, onsite and primarily remote. Wherever our colleagues are working, they’ll always have access to the TD community and experience our culture of care.

Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues. TD is a customer obsessed organization, and we are deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.

Inclusiveness
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
At TD, we’re committed to fostering an environment where all colleagues are encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work, experience equitable opportunities, and feel respected and supported. We’re dedicated to building an inclusive workforce that reflects the diversity of the customers and the communities in which we live and serve.

How We're Helping Make an Impact in Communities
TD has a long-standing commitment to help drive progress towards a more inclusive and sustainable future. That’s why we launched the TD Ready Commitment in 2018, now a multi-year North American initiative. Under the TD Ready Commitment, we are targeting a total of $1 billion by 2030 in community giving four key, interconnected drivers of change: Financial Security, Vibrant Planet, Connected Communities, and Better Health. It’s our goal to help support change, nurture progress, and contribute to making the world a better, more inclusive place for our customers, colleagues, and communities.

The Financial Planning Division within the City of Toronto provides timely, objective advice and information to Council and management staff of City divisions, agencies, boards and commissions, to ensure both the financial integrity of the Corporation, and the optimal balance between efficient, effective services levels, and levels of taxation and user fees.

Reporting to the Manager Financial Transformation, the Business Systems Analyst will support the Financial Planning Division's Budget Tool Revitalization initiative. This initiative aimed to procure a new single... cloud-based, enterprise-wide financial (budget) planning solution will replace two current systems used for the operating and 10-year capital budget and plan. The transition to the new planning solution is intended to facilitate a re-design of City budget processes to align with best practices, and strive for standardization across all City programs and agencies.

As a Business Systems Analyst, you will support the analysis and documentation of current business processes and provide advice on current processes re-engineering following the principles of standard best practices. As a key player in IT system configuration meetings you will provide a financial planning business perspective, support the development of functional specifications and documentation, and assess the best alternatives related to the implementation of the budget solution functionalities.

• Analyzes work performance of internal and external service providers with respect to quality, timeline, cost and completion of required tasks.

Job Category: Audit, Compliance & Inspections

Work Location: Metro Hall, 55 John Street

Job Type & Duration: Full-time, Temporary Vacancy (12 months)

Job Description

Reporting to the Manager, Risk Management, Employment and Social Services, you will be responsible for overseeing the delivery and implementation of risk management services in the Toronto Employment and Social Services (TESS) Division. This Senior Business Analyst position will see you establishing and fostering a risk management culture within the Division by engaging with stakeholders in identifying and mitigating risk to accomplish effective program/service objectives, and ensuring compliance with applicable policies and legislation, as... well as adherence to good management principles and practices. In addition, you will be tasked with developing a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of risk management, control and governance processes.

Major Responsibilities

Your primary responsibilities as a Senior Business Analyst – Risk Management will be varied, but you will be expected to:
• Provides strategic leadership and management of internal/external audits. This includes but is not limited to; City of Toronto’s Auditor General's Office, Internal Audit Division, Office of the Auditor General of Ontario (OAGO), and the Ontario Internal Audit Division (OIAD)
• Contributes to the Division’s ability to manage and analyze statistical data to find trends and/or identify potential risk.
• Supports large-scale projects/initiatives that incorporate proactive and innovative solutions to addressing business and operational challenges.
• Leads the Risk Management Unit (RMU) team in the utilization of data analytics for performance analysis that will contribute to the development of advanced recommendations for service improvements / service delivery.
• Oversees and supervises the risk management activities to support the Risk Manager / Director. This includes (but not limited to) promoting/building a culture of risk and awareness, integrity and accountability across the Division.
• Researches, defines, recommends and prioritizes new opportunities, continuous improvement, emerging technologies, tools, resources, methodologies and strategies to maintain and improve the Division’s change management and quality management systems.
• Leads complex qualitative/quantitative analysis to support the Risk Manager / Director with evidence based and outcome-oriented decision making.
• Facilitate the ongoing review and use of a risk management framework and the setting of standards by operational areas through consistent application of policy and practice approaches across the Division in alignment with the risk management framework.
• Support the development of the Risk Management Unit's work plans and priorities, respond strategically to emerging business specific legislative, regulatory and policy changes, and assess the impacts on the Division's processes and practices.
• Develop and maintain excellent knowledge of divisional priorities, objectives and operations to assist the Division in identifying and addressing potential risk areas and issues.
• Work collaboratively with program areas to coordinate implementation of detailed plans and recommend policies/procedures regarding program-specific requirements.
• Conduct research into assigned area, ensuring research takes into account developments within the field, corporate policies and practices, legislation and initiatives by other levels of government.
• Initiate, design, coordinate and implement program evaluations and operational reviews, audits and assessments to provide strategic advice to the divisional management team on issues and strategies for improving the efficiency and effectiveness of programs / services.
• Conduct business process and internal controls reviews/audits/assessments and develop recommendations and controls to identify and minimize reoccurrences of service delivery gaps / inefficiencies.
• Provide management staff with customer service improvement strategies as well as direction, guidance, processes and tools to increase efficiencies and improve effectiveness, including training, public education technological improvements, best practices and Division-wide communications.
• Ensure that proper and consistent internal controls are maintained and that requirements are met.
• Conduct audits and assessments of policy and procedures, and compliance to legislation as well as analyzing risk and identifying, describing and estimating risk affecting the achievement of divisional objectives and desired outcomes.
• Plan and design internal research projects on best practices and service data, and write and present reports, including recommendations for improving risk management in the Division.
• Prepare reports for senior management in the area of operational reviews, recommendations on changes in business methods and processes, including appropriate staffing levels, resources allocations, etc., policy recommendations and statistical analysis.
• Utilize various data information systems to monitor service standards, performance measures and fiscal accountability.
• Lead, coordinate, and participate on multidisciplinary project teams, and maintain professional relationships with other organizations and divisions.
• Oversee projects related to ensuring risk management in the Division, using project management techniques.
• Provide support, education and training to staff to build risk awareness within the Division.
• Represent the Division in meetings and initiatives with other divisions, service providers, and other orders of government.
• Provide input into, and administer assigned budget, ensuring that expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations.
• Apply knowledge of Ontario Works Act, related legislation, and TESS policies and procedures when planning, designing and implementing risk management strategies and when conducting reviews and audits/assessments.

Key Qualifications

Your application for the role of Senior Business Analyst – Risk Management must describe your qualifications as they relate to:
• Post-secondary education in a relevant field combined with relevant experience, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience, in one or more of the following fields of risk management: program oversight and/or business process review/quality assurance.
• Considerable experience in the implementation and evaluation of risk management methodologies and quality assurance strategies.
• Experience performing operational and compliance reviews as well as evaluation of programs and services.
• Experience in project management to work on projects and lead project management teams.
• Sound knowledge of business analysis, business process reviews, audit/assessment processes, practices and principles, risk management principles and standards, query reports, and compliance requirements to ensure system integrity, accountability and security.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to create collaborative Division-wide solutions, along with a good understanding of related tools used to collect data and conduct research and statistical analysis.
• Strong familiarity with collecting data, statistical analysis and related tools.
• Strong customer service orientation to collaborate with internal stakeholders and establish work plans that meet mutual objectives.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to liaise with internal stakeholders, and to facilitate training and provide direction to management clients.
• Ability to work in a multidisciplinary setting, both independently and within a team setting, with competing deadlines and priorities.
• Knowledge of operating in a legislated framework, including Social Assistance Legislation & Regulations (Ontario Works Act and Ontario Disability Support Program) and other inter-related legislation.

Shelter, Support & Housing Administration (SSHA) is responsible for managing a coordinated and effective system of shelter and homelessness services, working from Housing First and human rights approaches and with a focus on the people we serve. Toronto’s homelessness service system provides immediate, housing-focused, person-centered services for people experiencing homelessness, and consists... of emergency shelters, 24-hour respite sites, 24-hour and daytime drop-ins, temporary COVID-19 response programs, and street outreach services.

The primary roles of the homelessness service system within the broader approach to community and social services for vulnerable residents are to provide: Safe and welcoming emergency shelter and overnight services for those in housing crisis; Street or community outreach services for people staying outdoors, with a focus on establishing supportive relationships to address immediate health and safety needs and provide supports to move into shelter and housing; Supports for people experiencing or at risk of homelessness to develop tenancy maintenance and housing plans including access to housing stabilization supports; and Navigation and referrals to appropriate community and health services.

About the Role

The Business Analyst SSHA is responsible for developing, documenting, and analyzing policies and procedures, business processes and management practices related to data analytics, grants management, and strategic investments.

Major Responsibilities

• Recommends and implements data management tools and software to improve program efficiency.
• Leads and/or liaises with and participates in inter-divisional teams and staff working groups, committees, and external groups.

• Prepares reports for Managers and the Directors, highlighting trending information/data and discrepancies, making recommendations on changes in business methods and processes, including appropriate staffing levels and resource allocation.
• Create training, education, and communication materials to support new and/or modified business processes.
• Prepares business cases, feasibility studies, cost/benefit analyses, risk assessment, contingency planning.
• Develops project charters, business, and functional/technical requirements, designing documents, training strategies and plans and user documentation.
• Builds and manages relationships with divisional teams and staff working groups, Committees, and external groups to coordinate projects associated with business systems.
• Develops and delivers visual presentations, briefing materials and other documentation.
• Conducts research into assigned area ensuring that such research takes into account developments within the field, corporate policies and practices, legislation, and initiatives by other levels of government.
• Implements detailed plans and recommends policies/procedures regarding specific business and program requirements.
• Identifies a range of feasible options for operations, policies, technology, information systems and management practices, assessing the implications and viability of each option and recommending changes to improve grants management systems and service delivery.
• Supports the development of communications to contracted agencies regarding financial and program compliance matters.

Key Qualifications

• Considerable experience conducting data analysis and business process mapping (BPMN), as well as developing business improvement plans to streamline and create work efficiencies.

• Experience working with project teams to review and track requirements and scope documents.
• Experience working with a diverse range of stakeholders to understand and transform business processes.
• Ability to design and lead collaborative approaches with diverse partners to identify, design and test solutions to shared problems.
• Familiarity with public sector performance measurement and risk analysis, and the ability to research and track useful process and program measures for reporting the effectiveness and efficiency of divisional programs.
• Highly developed communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to effectively facilitate information sharing to update senior management, key stakeholders, staff in other divisions, community agencies and other levels of government.

• Ability to work independently in a demanding, fast paced, constantly changing environment; and prioritize multiple projects, processes, and work teams.
• Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office products to create reports, spreadsheets, presentations (e.g. Word, Excel, PowerPoint), as well as other relevant application products to create work process materials (e.g. MS Project, Visio) and SAP.
• Knowledge of the principles and practices employed in the effective analysis (both financial and general business processes) of business and government operations.
• Understanding of systemic barriers, racism and discrimination faced by Black, Indigenous and equity-deserving residents, and communities in Toronto.
• Ability to support the Toronto Public Service values to ensure a culture that champions equity, diversity, and respectful workplaces.

PROGRAM DESCRIPTION

The Homelessness Initiatives & Prevention Services team is responsible for oversight of the delivery of Toronto's shelter, 24-hour respite programs and street outreach services. The successful candidate will support the team by: collecting, documenting, and analyzing business policies and procedures, as well as management practices related to data analytics, grants management and strategic investments; developing and implementing standardized tools and resources that enhance our business processes; and using data to build process efficiencies to inform future service improvements.

An IIBA certified professional with a minimum of 5 years progressive experience in business analysis or product management positions with a strong focus on information technology projects.

Extremely well-versed in business analysis, business process management, quality assurance, project delivery practices, and standards across the project lifecycle.

Experienced with Jira and software solution lifecycle methodology including agile and waterfall development; ITIL certification is considered an asset.

A skilled presenter with strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills, and able to deliver proposals, gather business requirements and contribute perspective to support the stakeholder decision-making process.

The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for helping an Agile team provide support to the business by translating business needs into business rules and system configuration.

The Quality Assurance aspect includes creation, review and execution of test plans, logging of defects, and... resolution management with a high degree of communication with team members to ensure business requirements are satisfied.

Department Overview

Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD

We can’t afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. TD’s technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.

TD Business Systems Analysis covers a mandate that includes (but isn’t limited to) proposing technical systems to accomplish business requirements enterprise-wide. These experts build relationships with business partners and other groups of diverse subject matter experts and stakeholders (both internal and external) to:
• Plan + Elicit + Analyze + Document + Communicate +Manage system requirements;
• Assess client needs and recommend... the right technology; and
• Offer operational and process-related analysis and support.

There’s room to grow in all of it.

Job Details

About This Role

We are looking for someone to plan, manage, and lead the delivery of detailed system requirements and technical and functional specifications that align to standards and frameworks. You will provide technical leadership and work in close partnership with ambitious business and technology partners, project teams and stakeholders to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage detailed functional specifications.

• Develop data pipeline and monitoring dashboard for ongoing model performance monitoring.
• Define, document and translate business requirements into detailed functional specifications, taking into account non-functional requirements.
• Work on documentation and testing, communicate with vendors to support vendor model validation exercises.
• Evaluate and monitoring of model performance using common model performance monitoring metrics. Translate model output to actionable insights to support strategy improvements.
• Conduct meaningful qualitative and quantitative research and data analysis on vendor data and propose solutions to mitigate fraud issues and reduce friction on genuine customers.
• Analyze authentication data and work with stakeholders to identify business logic flaw, prevent unauthorized access and mitigate fraud events.
• Improve processes within area including but not limited to those related to reporting, planning, and forecasting; contribute to overall effectiveness of the organization.
• Assist in conducting value-added business analysis, insights, and recommendations to support business unit/client endeavors, including ad-hoc reviews, reporting, and takeaways with attribution analysis and executive summaries within own area or as assigned.
• Use strong communication skills to communicate complex issues in easily understandable terms.
• Apply sound judgement, discretion and collaborate with internal partners to navigate and resolve issues, and deliver value-added solutions.
• Assist testing teams in translating requirements and use cases into test conditions and expected results for product, performance, user acceptance, and operational acceptance testing.
• Contribute to project management activities such as: scoping and estimating project efforts, identifying risks and recommending mitigation measures, communicating activity status, as well as escalating and communicating possible issues.
• Participate in quality management reviews, including designs, prototypes and other requirements work products.
• Work closely with stakeholders to determine solution, assess impact to existing work processes and systems, and pinpoint how to manage integration.
• Respect existing processes and standards including requirements management and project management disciplines, technology delivery and business technology architecture, escalating issues as needed.
• Work with vendors to support business case development (consistent with technology requirements and guidelines) including benefits identification, RFI/RFP and service level agreements.

• Undergraduate degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other quantitative discipline.
• Graduate Degree preferred.
• 7+ years relevant experience.
• Advanced proficiency with SQL and Python working with large log data.
• Experience with fraud and fraud rule system, fraud model development/testing, model risk management experience within large Financial Institution.
• Experience with Threat Metrix and Lexis Nexis Solutions.
• Experience with AI and ML models and its application in identity verification, face verification and fraud.
